title: Special train service for ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’ suspended
byline: Sri Lanka Railways announced that the special trains from Colombo Fort to Kandy for the veneration of the Sacred Tooth Relic will not operate from tomorrow (24 April) until further notice.

title: Evening showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, North-western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts today (24).

title: Sri Lanka Police tighten inspections on off-bike helmet wearers
byline: The Police Headquarters has issued a directive to all officers across the island to closely monitor and inspect individuals behaving suspiciously wearing protective helmets, particularly while not riding the motorcycles.

title: Discussions on US trade tariffs successful; Joint statement expected soon - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says discussions between Sri Lanka and the United States on revising reciprocal trade tariffs imposed by US on Sri Lankan exports have been successful.

title: ‘Siri Dalada Vandanawa’ enters day 7
byline: The seventh day of ‘Siri Dalada Vandanawa’ continues to draw overwhelming crowds to Kandy, with an estimated 400,000 devotees queuing across the city to witness the sacred Tooth Relic of Lord Buddha.

title: Trump criticises Zelensky as Ukraine refuses Russian control of Crimea
byline: US President Donald Trump has accused Volodymyr Zelensky of harming peace negotiations, after the Ukrainian president said Kyiv would not recognise Russian control of Crimea.

title: Postal voting for 2025 LG Polls begins
byline: The marking of postal votes for this year’s Local Government (LG) elections commences today (April 24), with over 648,000 eligible voters expected to cast their ballots by mail.

title: ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’: Devotees urged to avoid arriving in Kandy till further notice
byline: The public are urged to avoid coming to venerate the Sacred Tooth Relic in Kandy until further notice in response to the massive influx of devotees currently waiting in the queues.

title: Apple, Meta fined as EU presses ahead with tech probes
byline: Apple was fined 500 million euros ($570 million) on Wednesday and Meta  200 million euros, as European Union antitrust regulators handed out the first sanctions under landmark legislation aimed at curbing the power of Big Tech.

title: Proposal to hold ‘Siri Dalada Vandanawa’ annually
byline: Governor of the Central Province Prof. Sarath Abeykoon states that a formal proposal has been submitted to the Mahanayake Theros and the ‘Diyawadana Nilame’ of the Temple of Tooth Relic to consider holding ‘Siri Dalada Vandanawa’ annually.

title: Convicted cardinal demands to be part of conclave to choose new pope, setting up Vatican standoff
byline: A cardinal convicted of financial crimes by the Vatican is claiming he can take part in the forthcoming conclave despite being listed as a “non-elector.”

title: Man sentenced to death for killing woman, dumping body in suitcase
byline: The Colombo High Court has sentenced to death a man who was convicted of the brutal murder of a woman in 2015, whose body was later discovered stuffed inside a suitcase at the Bastian Mawatha Bus Station in Colombo.

title: Govt. to continue “School Nutrition Programme” without interruption
byline: The Secretary to the President, Dr. Nandika Sanath Kumanayake stated that the government has taken a policy decision to continue, without interruption, the “School Nutrition Programme’’ aimed at reducing anemia among schoolchildren, which is being implemented with the assistance of the World Food Programme (WFP).

title: Main suspect in Dan Priyasad murder arrested
byline: The main suspect in the shooting and killing of political activist Dan Priyasad has been arrested, the police confirmed.

title: Sri Lanka to witness rare ‘smiley face’ planetary alignment on Friday
byline: Skywatchers in Sri Lanka are in for a rare celestial treat tomorrow (April 25), as a spectacular triple conjunction involving Venus, Saturn, and the Moon will briefly align gracing the early morning sky.

title: Court adjourns hearing of case against Diana Gamage
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has adjourned the hearing of the case filed against former State Minister Diana Gamage over the charges of violating immigration and emigration laws, until July 31.

title: Smooth start to postal voting for LG Polls, says Elections Commission
byline: The marking of postal votes for this year’s Local Government (LG) elections commenced today (24), and the Elections Commission states that the postal voting is proceeding smoothly, with no issues reported.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: Thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning are likely to occur at several places in Eastern, Uva, Central and North-central provinces and in Mullaitivu and Vavuniya districts, the Department of Meteorology warns.

title: 25 candidates arrested so far for violating election laws
byline: Two more candidates contesting the 2025 Local Government (LG) Election have been arrested for violating election laws, police said.

title: CID reports progress of probe into online train tickets racket
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (24) that further investigations are underway into the alleged major racket involving the reselling of ‘e-tickets’ for up-country trains including to Ella at inflated prices.

title: Sri Lanka declares national day of mourning for Pope’s funeral
byline: The Sri Lankan government has decided to declare April 26, 2025 (Sunday), a National Day of Mourning in view of late Pope Francis’ funeral.

title: 2025 LG Polls: 30 incidents of misuse of state power and resources reported
byline: The Executive Director of People’s Action for Free & Fair Elections (PAFFREL), Rohana Hettiarachchi, says that 30 incidents of misuse of state power and state resources have been reported in relation to the 2025 Local Government (LG) Election.

title: India will identify, track, punish every terrorist and their backers, PM Modi says after Kashmir attack
byline: India will identify, track and punish every terrorist and their backers, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Thursday, two days after 26 men were killed in an attack on tourists by suspected militants in the Himalayan territory of Kashmir.

title: Ex-CCD director Neville Silva surrender to Matara court
byline: Former Director of the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD), Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) Neville Silva, has surrendered to the Matara Magistrate’s Court today (24).

title: India suspends Pakistani visas following Pahalgam attack
byline: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) of India on Thursday said all existing valid visas issued by India to Pakistani nationals stand revoked with effect from April 27. The decision was taken in view of its retaliatory measures against Islamabad in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Schools closed on May 5 and 6 for LG polls
byline: The Ministry of Education announced that schools island-wide will be closed on May 05 and 06, in view of the 2025 Local Government Elections.

title: President offers condolences at Vatican Embassy on passing of Pope Francis
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake paid a visit to the Vatican Embassy this afternoon (24) to extend his condolences on the passing of His Holiness Pope Francis, according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: Pakistan closes air space for Indian airlines, warns against water treaty violation
byline: Pakistan closed its air space for Indian airlines and rejected New Delhi’s suspension of a water sharing treaty on Thursday in retaliation for neighbouring India’s response to a deadly militant attack in the Indian-ruled part of Kashmir.

title: IMF hopes to agree soon on next program review with Sri Lanka, official says
byline: The International Monetary Fund hopes to have an agreement soon on the next review of its program with Sri Lanka, Krishna Srinivasan, the director of the global lender’s Asia and Pacific Department, said on Thursday.

title: Trump tells Putin to ‘STOP’ after Russian attack kills 12 in Kyiv
byline: Russia pounded Kyiv with missiles and drones overnight, killing at least 12 people in the biggest attack on the Ukrainian capital this year and drawing a rare rebuke from Donald Trump who told Vladimir Putin: “Vladimir, STOP!”
